docs.text: more than forty years ago , the " sword and sandals " genre of historical epic ruled the box office .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during the 1950's hollywood sought to give audiences a reason to turn off their televisions and go out to the movies by offering the grand spectacle of the roman empire in cinemascope .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " ben-hur . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " cleopatra . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " the robe . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " sparticus . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " the fall of the roman empire . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " quo vadis . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sometimes brilliant , sometimes campy , the roman epic was the technicolor funeral pyre of classic hollywood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: since then , epics have appeared infrequently ( " the last emperor , " " braveheart " ) and some of the best have been small-screen affairs produced in the 1970's ( " roots , " " shogun " ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet , the phrase " we who are about to die salute you " has been absent until now .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " gladiator " begins in germania in a . d . 180 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: roman general maximus ( russell crowe ) has conquered yet another group of barbarians for his emperor marcus aurelius ( richard harris ) , and he is eager to retire to his plantation in spain where his wife and son are waiting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , the emperor is worried that his decadent weakling son commodus ( joaquin phoenix ) will prove a poor successor , so he wants to make maximus his heir as a transition toward rome becoming a republic again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when commodus hears the plan , he strangles his father and orders maximus and his family murdered .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maximus escapes from the executioners , but he arrives home too late to save his wife and son .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a caravan of slavers pick up the wounded hero and carry him off to north africa .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( why the caravan happened to be cruising by maximus' place is never explained . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an african named juba ( djimon hounsou ) treats maximus' wounds .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: proximo ( oliver reed ) , a gladiator who won his freedom , purchases maximus and juba as fodder for the arena .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of course , maximus proves as able a gladiator as he was a soldier , and his fame spreads .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when commodus reopens the coliseum , proximo brings his troupe of warriors to rome to compete .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: our hero wins the hearts and minds of the cheering crowds and finds that he has an ally in commodus' sister lucilla ( connie nielsen ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the similarities to " braveheart " are obvious : an evil king , a determined warrior seeking revenge for his murdered family , the aid of a lovestruck princess .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , like mel gibson's epic , " gladiator " has a primarily visceral appeal and is driven forward by the hero's anger .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a simple tale of good versus evil .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maximus has all the manly virtues : nobility of purpose , courage in battle , loyalty to king and country , physical stamina , and devotion to family .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: commodus is his opposite in every way : a sniveling , selfish coward who is intended to disgust the audience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the opening night crowd in my theater was about 70% male , and that seems appropriate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " gladiator " is a guy movie ( would the opposite of a " chick flick " be a " dick flick " ? ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's much pumping of testosterone and chopping off of body parts in gruesome battle sequences .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( those easily offended by gore should stay away . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lucilla is the only female character , and what sparks there are between her and maximus are dampened by his devotion to his dead wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joaquin phoenix gives an astounding performance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the scene where commodus kills his father , phoenix shows the pain of a son who has never had his father's love or pride .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: throughout the picture , phoenix manages to give depth to a character who's scripted as a caricature of evil .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i've been a russell crowe fan since " romper stomper . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this role doesn't offer him the complexities of his parts in " l .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a . confidential " and " the insider " -- essentially his job is to grunt heroically -- but his voice , which has a richard burton resonance textured by a clint eastwood rasp , is perfect for the genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the late oliver reed gave us the best work of his career in his last role .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i hope it will be rewarded with an oscar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my only major quibble with " gladiator " is its stylized look .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: several scenes are tinted .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we've seen a lot of the tinted look lately , particularly in " payback " and " the matrix . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i don't get the appeal of the style , which makes feature films look like tv ads .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in " payback " it was merely annoying , but in " gladiator " it bleaches the color out of the grand spectacles that are the raison d'etre of the roman epic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( perhaps it's meant to gloss over the imperfections of the computer-generated shots . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , the battle scenes are filmed in a strange herky jerky style that seems to be slo mo and fast forward simultaneously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( it reminds me of the way the flash runs in the comic books , leaving a half-blurred trail of images of himself behind . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with a more realistic look , " gladiator " could be even more satisfying than " braveheart " because it has a tighter script and a more fulfilling conclusion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bottom line : a rousing action film enriched by fine performances but tarnished by stylistic choices .
docs.label: positive
